triples.name: Question answering
triples.relevance: The primary task examined in the paper as a phenomenon relying on language comprehension, memory retrieval, and language generation.

triples.name: Language comprehension
triples.relevance: One of the key cognitive realms that question answering relies upon, foundational to understanding language input.

triples.name: Recall (memory)
triples.relevance: The memory retrieval process essential to question answering, involving accessing stored information from memory.

triples.name: Natural language generation
triples.relevance: The language generation component needed to produce answers as output in question answering systems.

triples.name: Natural language processing
triples.relevance: The broader field within which question answering is viewed as a problem, encompassing language processing tasks.

triples.name: Memory organisation
triples.relevance: A foundational theory needed to understand how human memory is structured and organized for effective information retrieval.

triples.name: Information processing (psychology)
triples.relevance: The theoretical framework describing question answering as a particular task in information processing and cognitive science.

triples.name: Artificial intelligence
triples.relevance: The broader field within artificial intelligence that provides computational approaches to question answering systems.
